alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Franklin, southeastern Stephens and western Hart Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Hartwell to 8 miles southeast of Carnesville. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carnesville, Royston, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Martin, Avalon and Tugaloo State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
